description.zh-cn: 1952年9月，中共中央将五个大行政区的地方局书记调入北京，以削弱地方权力，加强中央集权的重大政治事件。
description.en: A major political event in September 1952, where the Central Committee of the CCP transferred the secretaries of the five great administrative regions to Beijing to weaken local power and strengthen central authority.

nodes.id: 中国共产党中央委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会
en: Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的中央领导机构。
description.en: The central leading body of the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立初期设立的一级行政区域，后被撤销。
description.en: A first-level administrative region established in the early days of the People's Republic of China, which was later abolished.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，“五马进京”事件核心人物之一。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China, one of the core figures in the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，“五马进京”事件核心人物之一。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China, one of the core figures in the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，“五马进京”事件核心人物之一。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China, one of the core figures in the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，“五马进京”事件核心人物之一，后成为中国共产党第二代中央领导集体的核心。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China, one of the core figures in the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident, who later became the core of the second generation of central leadership of the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，“五马进京”事件核心人物之一。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China, one of the core figures in the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国首都。
description.en: The capital of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，曾任中华人民共和国主席。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China, who served as the Chairman of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，首任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China, the first Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立初期的一种经济政策。
description.en: An economic policy in the early days of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 一种经济体制，生产、资源分配以及消费等都由中央政府事先计划。
description.en: An economic system in which production, resource allocation, and consumption are planned in advance by the central government.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，曾任中华人民共和国代主席。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China, who served as the Acting Chairman of the People's Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中央人民政府国家计划委员会

zh-cn: 中央人民政府国家计划委员会
en: State Planning Commission of the Central People's Government

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立初期负责全国经济计划工作的机构，与政务院平级。
description.en: An organization responsible for national economic planning work in the early days of the People's Republic of China, at the same level as the Government Administration Council.

en: Government Administration Council of the Central People's Government

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立初期的中央人民政府，由周恩来担任总理。
description.en: The Central People's Government in the early days of the People's Republic of China, with Zhou Enlai as Premier.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物、军事家。
description.en: A politician and military strategist of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物、军事家。
description.en: A politician and military strategist of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物、军事家。
description.en: A politician and military strategist of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China.

relationships.target: 五马进京

description.zh-cn: 中共中央根据毛泽东的建议，决定调各中央局书记到中央工作，发起了“五马进京”事件。
description.en: Based on Mao Zedong's suggestion, the CCP Central Committee decided to transfer secretaries of various central bureaus to work in the central government, initiating the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident.

relationships.target: 大行政区

description.zh-cn: “五马进京”事件旨在削弱大行政区的地方权力，加强中央集权。
description.en: The 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident aimed to weaken the local power of the great administrative areas and strengthen central authority.

relationships.target: 中央人民政府国家计划委员会

description.zh-cn: 作为“五马进京”加强中央集权的一部分，中央人民政府于1952年11月成立了国家计划委员会。
description.en: As part of the centralization of power in the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident, the Central People's Government established the State Planning Commission in November 1952.

relationships.target: 五马进京

description.zh-cn: 朝鲜战争进入停战谈判阶段，经济恢复时期基本结束，为中国进行大规模经济建设和加强中央集权（如“五马进京”）创造了条件。
description.en: As the Korean War entered the armistice negotiation stage and the period of economic recovery basically ended, conditions were created for China to carry out large-scale economic construction and strengthen central authority (such as the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident).

relationships.target: 刘少奇

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东因不满刘少奇的新民主主义经济政策等问题，通过“五马进京”事件引入高岗等人以制衡刘少奇的权力。
description.en: Dissatisfied with Liu Shaoqi's New Democratic economic policies and other issues, Mao Zedong used the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident to bring in figures like Gao Gang to counterbalance Liu's power.

relationships.target: 周恩来

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东因不满周恩来在政务院的权力过大和其经济政策，通过“五马进京”事件引入高岗等人以制衡周恩来的权力。
description.en: Dissatisfied with Zhou Enlai's excessive power in the Government Administration Council and his economic policies, Mao Zedong used the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident to bring in figures like Gao Gang to counterbalance Zhou's power.

relationships.target: 新民主主义经济

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东不满新民主主义经济政策，希望通过“五马进京”及成立国家计委来转向社会主义计划经济。
description.en: Mao Zedong was dissatisfied with the New Democratic economic policy and hoped to shift towards a socialist planned economy through the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident and the establishment of the State Planning Commission.

relationships.target: 计划经济

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东希望通过“五马进京”及成立国家计委来推动社会主义计划经济的实施。
description.en: Mao Zedong hoped to promote the implementation of a socialist planned economy through the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing' incident and the establishment of the State Planning Commission.

relationships.source: 中央人民政府国家计划委员会
relationships.target: 中央人民政府政务院

description.zh-cn: 国家计划委员会成立后，与政务院平级，并接管了政务院管辖的经济大权，改变了政务院总理周恩来实际上掌管国家事务的局面。
description.en: After its establishment, the State Planning Commission was on the same level as the Government Administration Council and took over the economic powers under its jurisdiction, changing the situation where Premier Zhou Enlai effectively managed state affairs.

中央人民政府国家计划委员会
高岗

description.zh-cn: 董必武在“五马进京”后，称赞高岗为“一马当先”的“千里驹”。
description.en: After the 'Five Horses Enter Beijing', Dong Biwu praised Gao Gang as 'the leading horse' and a 'thousand-li horse'.
